meanings.definition: Make the best or most effective use of (a situation, opportunity, or resource).
meanings.sent1: She is optimizing her time by creating a schedule for her tasks.
meanings.sent2: The company is optimizing its production process to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was optimizing his snack choices by eating all the cookies first.
meanings.sent4: The coach emphasized the importance of optimizing their performance on the field.
meanings.sent5: By optimizing their study habits, the students were able to improve their grades significantly.

meanings.definition: Modify (a system) to make it as fully functional or effective as possible.
meanings.sent1: The IT team is optimizing the software to enhance its performance.
meanings.sent2: Engineers are constantly optimizing the design of the car for better fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to be optimizing its movements to dance gracefully.
meanings.sent4: The chef was optimizing the recipe to make the dish more flavorful.
meanings.sent5: By optimizing the settings, the photographer captured stunning images with the camera.
